course_description: This beginner-friendly course introduces Python fundamentals, guiding learners through variables, data types, control flow, functions, and basic data structures, enabling them to write and run simple programs with confidence.
course_overview: In this hands-on introductory course, students will explore the core concepts of Python programming through interactive lectures, live coding demos, and practical exercises. Starting with setting up a development environment, the curriculum covers variables, operators, data types, strings, lists, dictionaries, conditionals, loops, functions, and simple file I/O. Learners will practice writing and debugging code in real time, develop small projects such as a calculator and a text-based game, and gain confidence to continue their coding journey. No prior programming experience is required, but participants should be comfortable using a computer and navigating the internet.
target_audience: Aspiring programmers, students, career changers, or anyone with basic computer skills who wants to learn how to think computationally and create functional software using Python.
learning_outcomes: Write simple Python scripts that perform calculations and data manipulation
Explain core programming concepts such as variables, control flow, and functions
Apply conditional statements and loops to solve logical problems
Create reusable functions and modules to organize code
Debug Python code using error messages and built-in tools
Demonstrate the ability to read from and write to files
